alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Davidson; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:53PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Davidson, north central Williamson and southeastern Cheatham Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 253 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pegram, or 11 miles south of Ashland City, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ashland City, Nashville, Forest Hills, Belle Meade, Kingston Springs, Pegram, Bellevue, Berry Hill, Beaman Park, Bells Bend and Natchez Trace At Highway 96. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 186 and 212. Interstate 65 between mile markers 81 and 87. Interstate 24 between mile markers 47 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
